Detailed Description

Find intersections of straight ray with the flux surfaces, this class is obsolete.

CRayTrace is derived from CStconfig and is used for straight line tracing through flux surfaces. Usually you need only one method from this class,namely CRayTrace::traceLCMS(), to find the first intersection with LCMS. Then you can use CStconfig::xyz2mag() to get magnetic coordinates along the ray, see raytrace2::cpp.

Note:
This class is obsolete;
use the method CStconfig::getRayEntryPoint() and CStconfig::xyz2mag();
or C3dMesh::M3DgetRayEntryPoint() and C3dMesh::M3Dxyz2s()
See also:
class CStconfig, class C3dMesh, and raytrace2::cpp
Examples:

raytrace1.cpp.

Definition at line 28 of file CRayTrace.h.

int traceLCMS ( const Vector3d &  r1,
const Vector3d &  r2,
Vector3d &  entrypoint,
Vector3d &  exitpoint,
double  dpol = 1.,
double  dtor = 1. 
)

The method traces the Last Closed Magnetic Surface (LCMS).

The method finds intersections of the ray with the LCMS, where the ray is R(t)=r1+(r2-r1)/|r2-r1|*t, and t>=0.

Parameters:
r1 is the cartesian coordinates of the first point of the ray, must be outside with respect to the LCMS.
r2 is the cartesian coordinates of the second point of the ray
entrypoint this vector at return contains the coordinates of the entry point of the ray into plasma
exitpoint this vector at return contains the coordinates of the exit point
dpol is the angle step in degree along poloidal direction
dtor is the angle step in degree along toroidal direction
Returns:
  • -2 -- the origin r1 of the ray lies inside LCMS;
  • -1 -- the ray does not enters into plasma;
  • 0 -- segment r1--r2 is outside plasma;
  • 1 -- only entry point lies on the segment r1--r2, i.e. r2 is inside plasma;
  • 2 -- entry and exit points lie on the segment r1--r2, i.e. r1 and r2 are outside plasma;
if returned value >= 0 then entry and exit points of the ray are saved in entrypoint and exitpoint
Examples:
raytrace1.cpp.

void traceLast ( const Vector3d &  r0,
const Vector3d &  rd,
double  dtheta = 0.,
double  dphi = 0. 
)

The method traces the Last Closed Magnetic Surface (LCMS); obsolete method.

The method finds intersections of the ray with the LCMS. The ray is R(t)=r0+rd*t/|rd| with t>=0.

Parameters:
r0 is the origin of the ray, must be outside with respect to the LCMS.
rd is the direction of the ray
dtheta is the poloidal step for the triangulization of the LCMS
dphi is the toroidal step for the triangulization of the flux suface
Note:
Obsolete function; use traceLCMS() in stead of this method.

Referenced by MCTRACELCMS().

void traceAll ( const Vector3d &  r0,
const Vector3d &  rd,
double  dtheta = 0.,
double  dphi = 0.,
int  nSurf = 50 
)

The method traces magnetic surfaces; obsolete method.

The method finds intersections of the ray with the flux surfaces. The ray is R(t)=r0+rd*t/|rd| with t>=0.

Parameters:
r0 is the origin of the ray, must be outside with respect to the LCMS.
rd is the direction of the ray
dtheta is the poloidal step for the triangulization of the flux sufaces
dphi is the toroidal step for the triangulization of the flux sufaces
nSurf is the number of sufaces to trace, the surfaces are distributed equidistantly on reff.
Use getTraceSize(),getTraceRxyz(),getTraceLen() methods to get trace information
Note:
Obsolete function; it is better(and faster) to use traceLCMS() and then xyz2mag(), see raytrace1::cpp

int getTraceSize (  )  const

The method returns numbers of intersections of the ray with the magnetic surface or surfaces.

This method is used after traceLast() or traceAll() to get numbers of intersections.

Returns:
numbers of intersections or 0 if no intersections were found.

const Vector3d* getTraceRxyz (  )  const

The method returns pointer to the array of intersections.

The array contains cartesian coordinates of intersections of the ray with the magnetic surface/s. This method is used after traceAll() or traceLast(). The array size is getTraceSize()

Definition at line 108 of file CRayTrace.h.

const double* getTraceLen (  )  const

The method returns pointer to the array of lengths.

The array contains lengths between the first and successive intersections of the ray with the magnetic surface/s. This method is used after traceAll() or traceLast(). The array size is getTraceSize()

const double* getTracereff (  )  const

The method returns pointer to the array of effective radii.

The array contains effective radii of surfaces, which the ray intersects. This method is used after traceAll() or traceLast(). The array size is getTraceSize()
